VerR 0.0.1

Run expressions in environments

runInEnv.Rd

Execute R expressions in multiple environments.

Usage

runInEnv(expr, envName = envList())

Arguments

expr

An R expression to be evaluated.

envName

A `character()` specifying the environment(s) name(s).

Value

  • The result of the evaluated expression when length(envName) == 1.

  • A list of results for each environment when length(envName) > 1.

Examples

envCreate("my_env", packages = c("digest@0.6.18"))
#> - The project is out-of-sync -- use `renv::status()` for details.
#> # Downloading packages -------------------------------------------------------
#> - Downloading digest from Repository ...        OK [file is up to date]
#> Successfully downloaded 1 package in 0.68 seconds.

runInEnv(packageVersion("digest"), "my_env")
#> - The project is out-of-sync -- use `renv::status()` for details.
#> Error in packageVersion("digest") : there is no package called ‘digest’
#> Error: ! in callr subprocess.
#> Caused by error in `packageVersion("digest")`:
#> ! there is no package called ‘digest’
runInEnv(packageVersion("digest"))
#> - The project is out-of-sync -- use `renv::status()` for details.
#> Error in packageVersion("digest") : there is no package called ‘digest’
#> Error: ! in callr subprocess.
#> Caused by error in `packageVersion("digest")`:
#> ! there is no package called ‘digest’
